DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement SGOT (AST) SGPT (ALT) Eligibility Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services for any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting of measurement of serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase, serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase or alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement SGOT (AST) SGPT (ALT) Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services for any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting of measurement of serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase, serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase or alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Alkaline Phosphatase Measurement SGOT (AST) SGPT (ALT) Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.:Activity measured as a test of liver function, 46/47-kDa homodimeric human Aspartate Aminotransferases (Class-I Pyridoxal-Phosphate-Dependent Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. (NCI):Activity measured as a test of liver function, human Glutamic-Pyruvate Transaminases (Alanine Aminotransferase Family) are pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Glutamic Pyruvic Transaminases mediate conversion of major intermediate metabolites, catalyzing reversible transamination between alanine and alpha-ketoglutarate to form pyruvate and glutamate. (NCI):Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A quantitative measurement of alkaline phosphatase present in a sample.

A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in amino acid metabolism and in the urea and tricarboxylic acid cycles. Aspartate aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-aspartate to alpha-ketoglutarate forming oxaloacetate and L-glutamate.

A family of pyridoxal phosphate-dependent enzymes involved in cellular nitrogen metabolism, amino acid metabolism, and liver gluconeogenesis. Alanine aminotransferase specifically and reversibly catalyzes the transfer of an amino group from L-alanine to alpha-ketoglutarate forming pyruvate and L-glutamate.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are pre-study AST and ALT les
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST and ALT less than 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is screening visit alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x ULN (less than or equal to 5 x ULN for patients with documented liver involvement or bone metastases)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x ULN (less than or equal to 5 x ULN for patients with documented liver involvement or bone metastases)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal for age?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST (SGOT)/ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.0 x institutional upper limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST (SGOT) and ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x ULN OR less than or equal to 5 x ULN for patients with liver metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre study AST and ALT less than 10 x upper limit of normal, as assessed by treating investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 135 U/L (i.e., 3 x ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional ULN (less than or equal to 5 x ULN for subjects with liver metastasis), within 14 days prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional ULN (or less than or equal to 5 x upper limit of reference range if considered to be related to liver or bone metastases by the PI)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST (SGOT) and ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x the upper limit of normal OR less than or equal to 5 x the upper limit of normal for patients with liver metastases, within 3  days prior to the first day of 7+3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional ULN / 2 x institutional upper limit of normal, respectively?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal or 5 x the institutional upper limit of normal if liver metastasis is present within 14 days of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT) and ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (SGOT less than or equal to 39 U/L and SGPT less than or equal to 52 U/L)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study alkaline phosphatase less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional upper limit of normal (less than or equal to 5 x ULN for patients with documented liver or bone metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN), unless due to Gilbert's disease, hemolysis, or lymphomatous involvement of liver?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional ULN (less than or equal to 5 x ULN for subjects with liver metastasis), within 14 days prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - Corrected 20
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 2.5 x institutional ULN (less than or equal to 5 x ULN for subjects with liver metastasis), within 14 days prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex- 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 3 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN), unless due to Gilbert's disease, hemolysis, or lymphomatous involvement of liver, in which case AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) should be less than or equal to 5 x institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is AST or ALT > 3 x ULN clearly attributable to liver metastases?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 21
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST (SGOT) and ALT (SGPT) less than or equal to 3 times the institutional ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are pre-study AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 3 X institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) or less than or equal to 5.0 x institutional ULN for participants with documented liver metastases?
